data.title: Jelle Zijlstra
data.text:
This site hosts a few articles about my open-source software work:

Notes on the CPython project, my view of some common conventions and norms on the CPython open-source project

PEP 695, a deep dive into the implementation of PEP 695 - Type Parameter Syntax

Typing Council, some thoughts on my role on the Typing Council.

Improving the ast module in Python 3.13, notes on how the ast module is changing in Python 3.13.

Odd annotations, some odd or unexpected behaviors around annotations in Python

Talks

I have given talks and posters at various conferences over the years. This section lists those I was able to find back.

See also a list of my publications at my Hesperomys database.

Biology

The Westernmost Tarsier: A new genus and species from the Miocene of Pakistan (talk; Society of Vertebrate Paleontologists, Raleigh, NC, 2012)

Cataloging Animal Names with Python (lightning talk; PyCon US, Cleveland, OH, 2019)

Messages in a bottle: Small mammal bones from discarded bottles (poster; American Society of Mammalogists, Anchorage, AK, 2023)

Even old names can be new: changes in mammalian nomenclature since 2005 (talk; Jelle Zijlstra, Connor Burgin & Nate Upham, American Society of Mammalogists, Boulder, CO, 2024)

Software

Asynchronous Programming at Quora (talk; Pyninsula, Mountain View, CA, 2019)

pyanalyze: a semi-static typechecker (talk; Python typing online meetup, 2019)

The future of typeshed (talk; Typing Summit, PyCon US, Cleveland, OH, 2019)

Too small for a PEP: minor new typing features in Python 3.11 (talk; Typing Summit, PyCon US, Salt Lake City, UT, 2022)

PEP 688: Typing for the buffer protocol (lightning talk; PyCon US, Salt Lake City, UT, 2022)

Typing support for deprecations and errors (talk; Python typing online meetup, 2022)

State of Typing (talk; Typing Summit, PyCon US, Salt Lake City, UT, 2023)

PEP 695; or, how typing syntax led to a scoping rabbit hole (talk; PyCon US, Pittsburgh, PA, 2024)

Typing Summit (introductory talk; jointly with other organizers and members of the Typing Council; Typing Summit, PyCon US, Pittsburgh, PA, 2024)
